thread.title: Crystal Palace Confirm Deadline Day Loan Deal for Liverpool's Mamadou Sakho
thread.title_full: Crystal Palace Confirm Deadline Day Loan Deal for Liverpool's Mamadou Sakho | 90min

author: Liverpool
title: Crystal Palace Confirm Deadline Day Loan Deal for Liverpool's Mamadou Sakho
text:
​Liverpool outcast Mamadou Sakho will finally have the opportunity to play in the Premier League this season, after Crystal Palace secured a loan deal for the defender in the final hours of transfer deadline day.

The Eagles have brought in the French international central defender on a loan deal for the remainder of the current season, reportedly paying a fee of £2m for the move, after the Reds' demand of £20m for Sakho to make the deal permanent was not agreed upon by Palace. 
BREAKING: Mamadou Sakho joins @CPFC on loan from @LFC until the end of the season https://t.co/xt5GaIbqGz #DeadlineDay #SSNHQ pic.twitter.com/bFm6UYJAPq 
— Sky Sports News HQ (@SkySportsNewsHQ) January 31, 2017 
The 26-year-old has not featured at all for the Reds this season, with manager Jurgen Klopp revealing that he broke club rules before the campaign started. This in addition to the doping scandal from last season has left Sakho languishing in the reserves.

However, he will be hoping to resurrect his career in south London, with Crystal Palace manager Sam Allardyce keen to bolster his defensive options as he attempts to keep his side in the top flight.
